UPDATE: Parent Letter on Coronavirus - 3/13/20
Meg Krsacok
Thursday, March 12, 2020
div.p: March 13, 2020
Dear Lockland Parent/Guardian:
On March 12, Governor Mike DeWine ordered the closure of all schools throughout the state of Ohio after the close of school on Monday for three weeks to reduce the spread of COVID-19 (Coronavirus).

Lockland Local School District will be closed from Tuesday, March 17, 2020 through April 3, 2020 for this state-mandated closure. Spring break will remain as scheduled from April 6-13. Students are scheduled to return to school on Tuesday, April 14.

It is very important that students come to school on Monday, March 16 to collect resources and guidance from their teachers for the break. Students will also receive five days of breakfast and lunch at the end of the school day for the remainder of the week.

Closing school includes ALL school and all non-school sponsored activities. We understand the disappointment and inconvenience that these postponements and cancellations may cause to our families, students, staff, and the community. We are responding to the State of Ohio’s emergency order to slow the spread of the virus by cancelling large public gatherings.
Here are district plans in place in response to the current guidelines on COVID-19:

We have cancelled all indoor and outdoor events and field trips through April 3, 2020. As the situation continues to evolve, the district will re-evaluate and communicate any decisions with families as soon as they are reached.

All spring scrimmages and practices for the district are cancelled effective Friday, March 13-April 3, 2020. Coaches will be in touch with their athletes as our athletic director receives additional guidance from the OHSAA next week.

All medication can be picked up by parents/guardians at the school from Nurse Jen on Monday, March 16, 2020 between the hours of 8:30-3:30 p.m. After Monday, arrangements will have to be made with the school for pick up at a later date.

p.strong: Alternative Education Plans via Remote Learning

div.p: Lockland teachers (K-12) have been asked to prepare for the prospect of potential school closure. While we know that students may have limited access to technology and wifi, we will be sharing resources, activities and assignments that can be posted on our district web page for all to access as needed. Hard copies of materials will also be taken home by all students on Monday, March 16, 2020. Additionally, all students in grades K-12 will be permitted to take up to four books home on Monday from our libraries.

Our school office will be open from 8 a.m. - 3 p.m. on Tuesday, March 17 through Friday, April 3 to take phone calls. Please call (513) 563-5000. For health reasons, parents will not be buzzed in for face-to-face interaction.
Teachers will be available via email each day from 8:00-3:00 p.m. from Tuesday, March 17, 2020 through April 3, 2020.

Our students will be fed breakfast and lunch during the closure. Students will go home with five days of breakfast and lunch on Monday, March 16, 2020 at the end of the school day. Students/families will be able to pick up five breakfast/lunch meals on Monday, March 23, 2020 and Monday, March 30, 2020 between the hours of 11:00-12:00pm at Door #13 on the playground.
We have arranged for the sanitation of all surfaces in the school beginning on Friday, March 13, and this will continue for the duration of the time that the schools are closed.

This information is subject to change based on mandates from the State. Changes and updates will be posted to our website (www.locklandschools.org) and our social media pages Facebook @LocklandSchoolDistrict and Twitter @LocklandLocal.
The State Department of Health has set up a page for information and resources on the coronavirus: https://coronavirus.ohio.gov/
If you have questions about coronavirus, the Ohio Department of Health has set up a call center. You can reach the call center 7 days per week from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. at 1-833-4-ASK-ODH.
Thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate these challenging times.
Bob Longworth
Superintendent
